A mansion that could be straight out of the Hollywood Hills is back on the market for the first time in eight years.

'Roughlands' is located on the Wirral peninsula, just across the River Mersey from Liverpool and comes complete with its own tennis court and pavillion.

The prime location of Thurstaston means the property boasts fabulous views over the Dee estuary and the North Wales Coast.

Unsurprisingly given its luxury and location, it's only the third time the property has been listed on the market since it was built in 1928.

Described as a family home, Roughlands is bordered by mature trees to all sides in its 3.4 acre plot, providing an excellent sense of privacy and seclusion.

(Image: Savills)

(Image: Savills)

The LA-style mansion comes with a traditional twist however.

The panelled dining room with original leaded bay windows leads on to a gorgeous luxury kitchen - complete with a four oven Aga and a Belfast sink of course.

Panelled doors open into a large drawing room, with more bay windows. There are built in bookshelves and a fireplace finished with a timber mantlepiece.

(Image: Savills)

(Image: Savills)

The luxury doesn't end downstairs either, as the master bedroom with its en-suite and dressing room looks out directly onto the Dee estuary - it also comes with a roof terrace.

There is another double bedroom at the front of the house with a covered balcony, plus a guest room which also has its own en-suite.

Two further bedrooms can also be found at the back of the house which include built in shelves and cupboards - perfect to store your designer clothes and accessories.

(Image: Savills)

(Image: Savills)

(Image: Savills)

No expense has been spared outside either, as a sandstone terrace leads down to tiered gardens.

The lower lawn is guarded by hedges and gives access to the tennis court and pavillion. The grounds also feature a rock garden complete with an ornamental pond.

(Image: Savills)

(Image: Savills)

Charlie Kannreuther, head of residential sales at Savills in the North West and West Midlands, comments: "I was blown away by the incredible views on my first visit to Roughlands.

"Set in landscaped gardens in a private spot on the Wirral, and bordering mature woodlands and National Trust land, the house offers open views across the Dee Estuary to the North Wales coast.

(Image: Savills)

"This beautiful and functional family home offers an outstanding combination of privacy and accessibility, ideally situated for access to Liverpool and Chester, yet enjoying a large, secluded plot.

"It is on the market for only the third time since its construction in 1928."

If you're looking for a new home and Roughlands has taken your fancy, you can view the listing here - it's listed for a staggering £1.94 million.
description: A five-bedroom mansion on the Wirral peninsula is up for sale for only the third time since its construction in 1928 - and it's yours for just under £2 million.
